lead_paragraph: A repopulation of cougars in the Eastern U.S., with their steady diet of deer, could reduce the number of lives lost to deer-automobile collisions.

headline.print_headline: Study Suggests Letting Cougars Return to Native Range to Counter Killer Deer
headline.main: Too Many Deer on the Road? Let Cougars Return, Study Says

snippet: A repopulation of cougars in the Eastern U.S., with their steady diet of deer, could reduce the number of lives lost to deer-automobile collisions....
abstract: Study published in journal Conservation Letters calls for returning eastern cougars to their historic range in order to reduce white-tailed deer population; scientists conducting study note that deer are responsible for millions of car accidents each year, resulting in more than 200 deaths, and assert that reintroduction of cougars would save 155 lives over course of 30 years.
